alert.note: Alert for Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:29PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 515 PM MST... At 429 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Kaka, or 32 miles southeast of Gila Bend, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeman, Kaka and Big Horn. This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 136 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.

area.areaDesc: Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County
